Entries.Biography:
Jacob is the valley's mobile veterinarian who lost his wife Delilah some years ago after a long illness. He has been raising their daughter Eloise alone ever since.

**Personality:**

Jacob is reserved and at first may seem a little aloof, but that is more because he struggles with small talk. Once you have got to know him, however, he will start to open up a little more.

**Work:**

Jacob works as a mobile vet, and on Tuesdays takes his van around the greater valley area to visit farms and care for animals.

**Family:**

He is fiercely devoted to his daughter Eloise and clings to the memory of his beloved late wife, Delilah. He lives with Eloise and his mother Vivienne in their home in East Scarp.

Eloise.Heading: Eloise (daughter)
Eloise.Description: Jacob's daughter whom he is fiercely devoted to and has raised alone since his wife's death.

Vivienne.Heading: Vivienne (mother)
Vivienne.Description: Jacob's mother who lives with him and helps raise Eloise.

Delilah.Heading: Delilah (wife, deceased)
Delilah.Description: Jacob's beloved late wife who died after a long illness. He clings to her memory.

Clint.Heading: Clint (brother)
Clint.Description: The blacksmith from Pelican Town is Jacob's brother and Eloise's uncle.

Reserved.Heading: Reserved
Reserved.Description: Jacob is quiet and may seem aloof at first, particularly struggling with small talk.

Devoted.Heading: Devoted
Devoted.Description: He is fiercely devoted to his daughter Eloise.

StillGrieving.Heading: Still Grieving
StillGrieving.Description: He clings to the memory of his late wife Delilah and is still processing her loss.

Caring.Heading: Caring
Caring.Description: As a veterinarian, he shows deep care for animals and their wellbeing.

GraduallyOpening.Heading: Gradually Opening
GraduallyOpening.Description: Though reserved at first, he opens up more as he gets to know people better.

Entries.BiographyEnd: Jacob represents the quiet strength of single parenthood and the enduring nature of grief, balancing his devotion to his daughter with his work caring for the valley's animals while honoring his late wife's memory.
